intro: Koanophyllon juninense, commonly known as the Junín prickly pear, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Cactaceae family and is characterized by its spiny stems and clusters of yellow flowers. The plant is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing typical xerophytic features such as reduced leaves and thick, fleshy stems for water storage. Its flowers are pollinated primarily by insects, and the plant produces small, edible fruits. Koanophyllon juninense plays a role in local ecosystems and is of interest for its potential in horticulture and conservation efforts.
